home.customInserts: This paragraph contains multiple inserts. First {{insert}} is a <0>div with a classname</0>. Second is <1>bold</1>. Third is <2>italic</2>. Finally there is a <3>link</3>.

createTopic.topicNameLabelBody: This is the unique identifier for this topic within this cluster. You'll need this to set up your producers and consumers, so make it something memorable.
createTopic.partitionsLabelBody: A partition is an ordered list of messages. One or more partitions make up a topic.
createTopic.replicasLabelBody: In order to improve availability, each topic can be replicated onto multiple brokers. If a following replica is keeping up with the partition leader, its replica is in-sync. Any follower with an in-sync replica can become the leader without losing any messages.
createTopic.inSyncReplicasLabelBody: Determines the reliability guarantee achievable for this topic. The minimum number of replicas that must acknowledge a write to satisfy a producer that requests acknowledgements from all replicas. (min.insync.replicas)
createTopic.retentionTimeLabelBody: The length of time that messages are retained before they are deleted. If your messages are not read by a consumer within this time, they will be missed. (retention.ms)
createTopic.messageTimestampLabelBody: Determines if the timestamp is made when the message is created or when the message is appended to the log. (message.timestamp.type)
createTopic.messageTimestampDiffLabelBody: The maximum difference allowed between the timestamp of the message leaving the producer and arriving at the broker. (message.timestamp.difference.max.ms)
createTopic.compressionTypeLabelBody: Determines the final compression for the topic, or whether to retain the compression set by the producer. (compression.type)
createTopic.cleanupPolicyLabelBody: Determines what happens to log segments beyond the retention window. (cleanup.policy)
createTopic.retentionBytesLabelBody: The maximum total size of a partition's log segments before old log segments are deleted to free up space. (retention.bytes)
createTopic.logSegmentLabelBody: The size of the log segment files. Log processing such as deletion and compaction operates on log segments, so a larger setting gives fewer files but less frequent log processing. (segment.bytes)
createTopic.leaderElectionLabelBody: Allows a replica which is not in-sync to become the leader of the partition. This is only done as a last resort and can lead to data loss. (unclean.leader.election.enable)
createTopic.followerReplicaLabelBody: A list of the replicas for which replication should be throttled on the follower side. Can be used to limit the network bandwidth consumed by replication. (follower.replication.throttled.replicas)
createTopic.leaderReplicaLabelBody: A list of the replicas for which replication should be throttled on the leader side. Can be used to limit the network bandwidth consumed by replication. (leader.replication.throttled.replicas)
createTopic.deleteRetentionLabelBody: Determines the time for which tombstone markers are retained if the topic is compacted. (delete.retention.ms)
createTopic.minRatioLabelBody: Determines the frequency of compacting the log in terms of the proportion of duplicated keys allowed. Applies only to compacted topics. (min.cleanable.dirty.ratio)
createTopic.minLagLabelBody: The minimum time a message will remain uncompacted. Applies only to compacted topics. (min.compaction.lag.ms)
createTopic.segementTimeLabelBody: The period of time after which the current log segment is rolled even if it is not full. This permits log processing such as deletion and compaction to proceed for quiet topics. (segment.ms)
createTopic.jitterTimeLabelBody: Controls a random delay to add to log segment rolling with the aim of preventing bursts of log segment rolling activity. (segment.jitter.ms)
createTopic.deleteDelayLabelBody: The delay before deleting a file from the filesystem. (file.delete.delay.ms)
createTopic.preallocateLabelBody: Determines whether to preallocate log segment files. (preallocate)
createTopic.indexIntervalLabelBody: Determines the granularity of the offset index. (index.interval.bytes)
createTopic.segementIntervalLabelBody: The size of the index that maps offsets to file positions. (segment.index.bytes)
createTopic.intervalMessagesLabelBody: Determines the number of messages between flushing data to the log. Replication is a better way to ensure data is not lost when failures occur. (flush.messages)
createTopic.intervalTimeLabelBody: Determines the interval in time between flushing data to the log. Replication is a better way to ensure data is not lost when failures occur. (flush.ms)
createTopic.coreConfigInfo: We recommend you fill out and evaluate these details at a minimum before deploying your topic.
createTopic.messageSectionInfo: These details control how your messages will be handled in the Kafka instance.
createTopic.logSectionInfo: Messages are continually appended to the partitionâ€™s log. This is when they are assigned their offset. These details define how your log is handled.
createTopic.replicationSectionInfo: These details control the behavior of your replicas. Each of these parameters has an impact on every replica created in this topic.
createTopic.cleanupSectionInfo: These details control the cleanup processing of the log.
createTopic.indexSectionInfo: These details control the indexing of the log.
createTopic.flushSectionInfo: These details control the frequency of the flushing of the log.
createTopic.deleteTopicInfo: This permanently removes this topic from this instance of Strimzi. Applications will no longer have access to this topic.
